sn8.3:4.1: At one time Venerable Vaṅgīsa was staying near Āḷavī, at the Aggāḷava Tree-shrine, together with his mentor, Venerable Nigrodhakappa.
sn8.3:4.2: Now at that time Venerable Vaṅgīsa looked down on other good-hearted mendicants because of his own poetic virtuosity.
sn8.3:4.6: that I look down on other good-hearted mendicants because of my own poetic virtuosity.”
sn8.3:4.7: Then, on the occasion of arousing remorse in himself, he recited these verses:
sn8.3:5.2: Completely abandon the different kinds of conceit!
sn8.3:5.3: Infatuated with the different kinds of conceit,
sn8.3:5.4: you’ve had regrets for a long time.
sn8.3:6.1: Smeared by smears and slain by conceit,
sn8.3:6.3: When people slain by conceit are reborn in hell,
sn8.3:6.4: they grieve for a long time.
sn8.3:7.1: But a mendicant who practices rightly,
sn8.3:7.3: They enjoy happiness and a good reputation,
sn8.3:7.4: and they rightly call him a ‘Seer of Truth’.
sn8.3:8.1: So don’t be hard-hearted, be energetic,
sn8.3:8.2: with hindrances given up, be pure.
sn8.3:8.3: Then with conceit given up completely,
sn8.3:8.4: use knowledge to make an end, and be at peace.”
